property.name: Text
property.value: Play Enchanted Armor under the control of any investigator at your location. Forced – After damage and/or horror is placed on Enchanted Armor: The owner of Enchanted Armor tests ά (X), where X is the total amount of damage and horror on it. If the test fails, discard Enchanted Armor and assign the damage and/or horror just placed on it elsewhere.

property.name: Text
property.value: ι When a second [Bless] token is revealed during a single skill test at your location, exhaust Blessing of Isis: Cancel that token and treat it as if it were a ε token instead. Return both of those tokens to the chaos bag after this test ends.

property.name: Text
property.value: You can only include this asset in your deck by upgrading it from Cryptic Grimoire (Untranslated), and only if “you have translated the grimoire” in your Campaign Log.ι After you resolve 1 or more [Curse] tokens during a skill test: Place that many secrets on Cryptic Grimoire.ι When you play an Insight event during your turn, spend 2 secrets: That event gains fast. Reduce its cost by 1.

property.name: Text
property.value: You can only include this asset in your deck by upgrading it from Cryptic Grimoire (Untranslated), and only if “you have translated the grimoire” in your Campaign Log.ι After you resolve 1 or more [Curse] tokens during a skill test: Place that many secrets on Cryptic Grimoire.ι When you would draw the top card of the encounter deck, spend 5 secrets: Draw a card from your deck instead.

property.name: Text
property.value: Fight. When you initiate this attack, add up to 3 [Curse] tokens to the chaos bag. For each [Curse] token added to the chaos bag in this way, you get +1 ή and deal +1 damage for this attack.

property.name: Text
property.value: ι After your turn begins: Choose two skills. Until the start of your next turn, you get +1 to each of those skills. ι After any skill test ends in which a total of 3 or more [Curse] or [Bless] tokens were revealed: Play Tristan Botley from your hand, at no cost.

property.name: Text
property.value: ι When a second [Curse] token is revealed during a single skill test at your location, exhaust Curse of Aeons: Cancel that token and treat it as if it were a α token instead. You may choose to remove both of those tokens from the chaos bag after the test ends.

property.name: Text
property.value: Max 1 committed per test. After you commit Unrelenting to a skill test, search the chaos bag for up to 3 non-ζ chaos tokens of your choice, and seal them on Unrelenting. If all 3 tokens sealed on Unrelenting are “+1,” “0,” [Bless], and/or ε tokens, draw 2 cards. Release all tokens sealed here after this test ends.

property.name: Text
property.value: Commit only to a skill test you are performing, and only if the difficulty of that test is higher than your base skill value. After you commit Signum Crucis to a skill test, add X [Bless] tokens to the chaos bag. X is the difference between the test's difficulty and your base skill value.

property.name: Text
property.value: α: –1 (–3 instead if there are 6 or fewer locations remaining in the Road deck). β: –1. For each point you fail by, an investigator in your vehicle places 1 of their clues on your location. γ: –2. For each point you fail by, an investigator in your vehicle loses 1 resource. δ: –4. If you fail, resolve the hunter keyword on each enemy in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: α: –2 (–4 instead if there are 6 or fewer locations remaining in the Road deck). β: –2. For each point you fail by, an investigator in your vehicle places 1 of their clues on your location. γ: –3. For each point you fail by, an investigator in your vehicle loses 1 resource. δ: –4. Resolve the hunter keyword on each enemy in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: As an additional cost for you to move while not in a vehicle, you must spend 2 actions. Forced – At the end of the round: Starting with the rearmost location, set each location with no vehicles, enemies, or investigators aside, out of play (or add it to the victory display if it has Victory X and has no clues on it). Stop when you reach a location with at least 1 vehicle, enemy, or investigator; or the location behind the rearmost investigator.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn – Rearmost location. Hunter. Massive. Retaliate. Forced – When The Terror of Devil Reef would be defeated: Instead, remove all damage from it and exhaust it. It cannot ready for the remainder of the round.

property.name: Text
property.value: As an additional cost for you to move while not in a vehicle, you must spend 2 actions. Forced – At the end of the round: Starting with the rearmost location, set each location with no vehicles, enemies, or investigators aside, out of play (or add it to the victory display if it has Victory X and has no clues on it). Stop when you reach a location with at least 1 vehicle, enemy, or investigator; or the location behind the rearmost investigator.

property.name: Text
property.value: Flip over each vehicle that is running, so that it is stopped. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. If there are 3 or 4 investigators in the game, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a Vehicle enemy or Malfunction treachery is discarded. The lead investigator draws that card.

property.name: Text
property.value: As an additional cost for you to move while not in a vehicle, you must spend 2 actions. Forced – At the end of the round: Starting with the rearmost location, set each location with no vehicles, enemies, or investigators aside, out of play (or add it to the victory display if it has Victory X and has no clues on it). Stop when you reach a location with at least 1 vehicle, enemy, or investigator; or the location behind the rearmost investigator.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each enemy gains hunter. Forced – At the end of each investigation phase: Each vehicle that is running must move to a connecting Road location of the driver’s choice. Objective – Drive to Falcon Point as fast as you can! (You will be instructed when to advance.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Objective – If each undefeated investigator is at Falcon Point Approach, advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 1 clue for each investigator in that vehicle. For each clue they could not spend, an investigator in that vehicle takes 2 horror. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 2 clues for each investigator in that vehicle. For each clue they could not spend, an investigator in that vehicle takes 1 horror. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 2 clues for each investigator in that vehicle. For each clue they could not spend, an investigator in that vehicle takes 2 horror. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 2 clues for each investigator in that vehicle. If they cannot, the vehicle’s driver tests ά (X) or ί (X), where X is the number of clues they could not spend. If the driver fails, their vehicle is removed from the game and each investigator in that vehicle takes 10 damage. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 2 clues for each investigator in that vehicle. If they cannot, the vehicle’s driver tests ά (X) or ί (X), where X is the number of clues they could not spend. If the driver fails, their vehicle is removed from the game and each investigator in that vehicle takes 10 damage. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 2. θ Investigators at this location spend 1π clues, as a group: Look at the revealed side of any location ahead of this one.

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 2. θ Investigators at this location spend 1π clues, as a group: Look at the revealed side of any location ahead of this one.

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 3. θ Investigators at this location spend 1π clues, as a group: Look at the revealed side of any location ahead of this one.

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 3. θ Investigators at this location spend 1π clues, as a group: Look at the revealed side of any location ahead of this one.

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 1 clue for each investigator in that vehicle. For each clue they could not spend, an investigator in that vehicle takes 2 damage. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 2 clues for each investigator in that vehicle. For each clue they could not spend, an investigator in that vehicle takes 1 damage. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 2 clues for each investigator in that vehicle. For each clue they could not spend, an investigator in that vehicle takes 2 damage. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 2 clues for each investigator in that vehicle. If they cannot, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a Vehicle enemy is discarded and spawn that enemy at Desolate Road. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – When a vehicle leaves this location: Investigators at this location, as a group, must spend 1 clue for each investigator in that vehicle. If they cannot, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a Vehicle enemy is discarded and spawn that enemy at Desolate Road. (Limit once per game for each vehicle.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Road 1. Forced – After a vehicle enters Long Way Around: Place 1 doom on the current agenda (this may cause the current agenda to advance). That vehicle cannot leave Long Way Around until the end of the next round.

property.name: Text
property.value: Vehicle. Limit 2 investigators in this vehicle. This vehicle is running. Investigators cannot enter or leave it. η If you are this vehicle’s driver: Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, move this vehicle to a connecting Road location. (Max once per round.) η If you are this vehicle’s driver: You stop the car. Flip this vehicle over.

property.name: Text
property.value: Vehicle. Limit 2 investigators in this vehicle. This vehicle is stopped. η If you are this vehicle’s driver: You start the car. Flip this vehicle over.

property.name: Text
property.value: Vehicle. Limit 2 investigators in this vehicle. This vehicle is running. Investigators cannot enter or leave it. η If you are this vehicle’s driver: Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, move this vehicle to a connecting Road location. (Max once per round.) η If you are this vehicle’s driver: You stop the car. Flip this vehicle over.

property.name: Text
property.value: Vehicle. Limit 2 investigators in this vehicle. This vehicle is stopped. η If you are this vehicle’s driver: You start the car. Flip this vehicle over.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn – Rearmost location. Hunter. Forced – When Pursuing Motorcar attacks you, if you are not in a vehicle: It deals +2 damage for this attack. Forced – When Pursuing Motorcar attacks an investigator in a vehicle: It attacks each other investigator in that vehicle, as well.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn – Rearmost location. Hunter. Retaliate. Hit Van cannot attack during the same phase it moved via its hunter keyword.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hunter. Forced – After Hybrid Assassin moves via its hunter keyword, if it is unengaged: Resolve its hunter keyword again. (Limit once per round.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – If you are... –...not in a vehicle, test ί (5). If you fail, take 3 damage. –...in a vehicle, that vehicle’s driver tests ί (3). If the driver fails, each investigator in your vehicle takes 2 damage.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – If you are... –...not in a vehicle, test ά (5). If you fail, take 3 horror. –...in a vehicle, that vehicle’s driver tests ά (3). If the driver fails, each investigator in your vehicle takes 2 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ά (4). If you fail, you must either discard an asset you control, or discard 1 card from your hand for each point you failed by. If you fail and you are in a vehicle, each other investigator in your vehicle must also resolve this effect as if they had just failed.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Resolve the hunter keyword on each enemy in play. If no enemies move as a result of this effect, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a Vehicle enemy is discarded and spawn that enemy at the rearmost location.
